text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to share
with you my take on something really
using simple perfect for when you have
leftovers it's what I like to call my
chicken into a lot of stuffed peppers
like I said they're really easy they
just require a handful of ingredients
and like I always say you can mix and
match with whatever you have on hand and
whatever you like let me take you over
the ingredients so we can get started
you'll need some cooked chicken I've got
some black beans that have been cooked
some corn I've got some chopped up
scallions and cilantro you're going to
need some enchilada sauce and my
favorite is the mild red enchilada sauce
and this is some shredded white cheddar
you can use any cheese you like and for
peppers you can use bell peppers which I
often do but I found these really
beautiful poblano peppers so that's what
I'm going to use today I've got my oven
preheated to 400 and now what I'm going
to do is an optional step but I like
doing it it gives you like a little bit
of smokiness layer flavor to the dish
I've got my grill pan as you can see
it's really really hot I'm preheating
over high heat and all I'm going to do
no oil nothing I'm just going to throw
my peppers on there and I'm just going
to cook them for like about a minute or
two on each side just to char them a
little tiny bit you can even use a
skillet like a cast-iron skillet if you
don't have a grill pan or you can always
throw them on the outdoor grill for a
minute or two if you've got that so what
that's happening so easy and so simple
you've got all your fixings in here
right now my chicken is already salted
because this was poached and my black
beans are already seasoned so I don't
have to add any additional salt to this
but tasty owers make sure that if you
need to add any salt pepper you do so
I'm going to add a little bit of my
enchilada sauce to the actual filling
along with some cheddar now you can use
anything in here you don't have to use
chicken you can use different kinds of
meats you don't have to use meat at all
you could use rice you can do whatever
your heart desires but this is what I
tend to always have on hand or kind of
my staples and I always have black beans
and corn in the freezer so I just like
to add that right in because it's just
what I tend to have on
and I'm going to just set this aside I
need a little bit more sauce I'm going
to set this aside I'm going to flip my
peppers they look good use tongs I'm
just used to using my hands I'm going to
let them cook for another minute or so
let them cool for a bit and then we will
proceed
these are cooled a bit I've got some
enchilada sauce in the bottom of my pie
dish pie dish casserole dish whatever
the oven is preheated at 400 and now
it's really easy all you do is just you
stuff your peppers you don't want to
over stuff these because you don't want
them to kind of fall apart but you know
you want to be generous that looks good
enough I'd say and then just line them
up once they're all stuffed just drizzle
some more of your enchilada sauce over
the top and I know there's nothing
authentic about this whatsoever not at
all saying that it is but I'm saying
it's authentically delicious and when
you love enchilada as much as I do
and when you find your perfect
combination that's what you stick with
you know but these are really easy and
the whole point about these and why I
love them is that I can make them
vegetarian with some rice and beans I
can make them with leftover steak it can
make them leftover pork I can make them
with left or anything so I can use
whatever peppers I want poblanos just
happened to be they've got a little bit
of heat to them which balance is that
really what with a sweet corn chicken is
just universal and it soaks up any
flavor you put you know you get you give

I've let them cool for about 15 minutes
because when you pull it out that sauce

but I don't want that to happen to you
